plugins.name: Hints
plugins.description:
Hints is an AI-powered Figma plugin that helps you quickly rename, group, and restructure your layers using smart, semantic naming and auto-layout suggestions.

> - Instantly rename layers with AI (Qwen) based on design context

> - Group and organize layers by semantic prefixes

> - Preview and apply auto-layout frames with smart direction and spacing

> - Works with Figma‚Äôs latest auto-layout features

> - Great for design systems, handoff, and large files

>

> Save time, reduce manual work, and keep your Figma files organized and developer-friendly!
plugins.tagline: AI-powered Figma layer renamer Design system assistant & auto-layout assistant

plugins.name: Skeema
plugins.description:
What is Skeema?

Skeema is a Figma plugin that integrates API documentation directly into your design workspace. It allows frontend developers and designers to access API schemas for specific design components, making it easier to align designs with backend structures and speed up the development process.


How does Skeema work?

It connects your Figma designs to the relevant API documentation. By clicking on a design element, you can instantly view the associated endpoint documentation, eliminating the need to search through long API docs.


Who is Skeema for?

This plugin is designed for frontend and backend developers, and teams who work with API-driven applications. It helps bridge the gap between design and development, making UI-based API integration and collaboration smoother and more efficient.


What are the key benefits of using Skeema?

  1. üöÄ Faster API integration: No more switching between tools. Get API docs directly inside Figma.
  2. üéØ Better accuracy: Ensure your design components match the API structures, reducing development errors.
  3. üë©‚Äçüíª Streamlined collaboration: Designers and developers stay aligned, minimizing back-and-forth communication.


Do I need technical skills to use Skeema?

While Skeema is built with developers in mind, it's intuitive enough for designers to use as well. Its UI is designed to seamlessly integrate into your existing Figma workflow, making it accessible for anyone involved in the design and development process.


What APIs does Skeema support?

Skeema is designed to work with OpenAPI (Swagger) specifications, but it can support a wide range of RESTful APIs. As long as your API has proper documentation, Skeema can link it to your Figma designs.


Is Skeema free?

Skeema offers both a free version with basic features and a premium version with advanced features such as team collaboration, extended API support, and priority access to updates.


Can I use Skeema with my team?

Yes! Skeema is built for collaborative teams. You can easily share API-linked designs with your development team, ensuring that everyone stays on the same page and works with the latest API documentation.
plugins.tagline: Skeema integrates API documentation directly into your design workspace. Simply click to view docs.

Get accurate font-weight, font-size, color, line-height, and letter-spacing instantly, formatted in pure CSS.


Perfect for developers and designers who want a fast way to turn styled text into usable web code.

This Figma plugin scans for contrast issues, touch target sizes, font readability, and color-blindness concerns‚Äîhelping you create user-friendly designs effortlessly. Get instant AI suggested insights and basic fixes to improve accessibility in real-time! üöÄ
128248.release_notes:
üîß Version 3.0 ‚Äì Now with Auto-Fix!
We‚Äôre back with a powerful update! üéâ

üÜï What‚Äôs New in v3.0
‚ú® Auto-Fix for Font Size
Text nodes that fall below accessibility standards are automatically updated to a minimum readable size of 12px.

‚ú® Auto-Fix for Touch Targets
Interactive elements smaller than 48x48 px are now automatically resized to meet accessibility guidelines for tap targets.

These improvements help you stay WCAG-compliant with just one click. Perfect for speeding up your design workflow while ensuring usability for all.
128248.tagline: Design with Clarity: Smarter, Accessible, Inclusive üöÄ

plugins.name: Little Bro
plugins.description:
Your Personal Design Mentor for Growth, Confidence, and Impact

Little Bro is the ultimate tool for designers who want to elevate their craft and make a real impact. Whether you're a junior designer, freelancer, or aspiring creative, Little Bro provides the mentorship and tools you need to thrive in your design journey.


  1. Instant Feedback on UX and Usability: Get real-time insights into your designs with usability simulations that help you identify pain points and improve user satisfaction.
  2. Accessibility Standards Made Simple: Ensure your designs are inclusive and meet accessibility standards effortlessly, making your work usable for everyone.
  3. Overcome Creative Blocks: Stay inspired and productive with strategies to spark creativity and keep your projects moving forward.
  4. Refine Your Presentation Skills: Learn to articulate your design decisions with clarity and confidence, helping you win over clients, teams, and stakeholders.
  5. Continuous Skill Development: With guidance refined by senior, staff, and director-level UI/UX and product designers, Little Bro helps you grow into the confident, skilled designer you aspire to be.


Little Bro is more than just a tool‚Äîit's your partner in mastering the art of UI/UX. From instant feedback to accessibility and usability insights, Little Bro is here to help you create designs that are not only beautiful but also functional and impactful.


Join a community of designers transforming their careers with Little Bro and unlock your full potential today.
plugins.tagline: A companion to help you design better, faster, and smarter

plugins.name: Mavity Figma Plugin
plugins.description: The plugin is a tailored tool designed to convert web pages into Figma designs with specific adjustments for seamless integration with Mavity. It works by using a Chrome extension to extract the structure and elements of a web page, converting them into a JSON format. This JSON is then processed by the plugin, which translates it into an editable design within Figma, ensuring compatibility and efficiency for Mavity workflows.
plugins.tagline: Converts web pages to Figma designs using a Chrome extension and JSON transformation.

plugins.name: SpeX - Design to Code by AI
plugins.description:
SpeX ‚Äì Design to Code by AI


Transform your Figma components into AI-readable specs for seamless design-to-code automation.


üîç What is SpeX?

SpeX bridges design and development by exporting structured specifications from Figma‚Äîenabling AI tools like Cursor and GitHub Copilot to generate accurate, production-grade UI code that aligns with your actual components.


üéØ Who It's For

  1. Design system teams scaling reusable components
  2. Developers using AI coding assistants
  3. Product teams aiming for consistent handoffs
  4. Organizations enforcing structured design workflows


üöÄ Key Capabilities


üìã AI-Ready Export

  1. Export to YAML/JSON with full style tokens
  2. Support nested components, variants, and instances
  3. Auto-detect and optimize SVG icons
  4. Generate component preview thumbnails


üîß Fine-Tuning Metadata

  1. Add codeComponent and codeFilePath
  2. Auto-fill metadata via pattern recognition
  3. Visual tree browser with search and bulk editing


üóÉ Component Record Management

  1. Full CRUD for structured records
  2. Sync from Notion, APIs, or JSON files
  3. Filterable views with fallback thumbnails
  4. Export component registry as JSON


ü§ñ Real-Time AI Integration

  1. WebSocket-based MCP bridge for tools like Cursor AI
  2. Real-time dashboard and analytics
  3. Serve specs, manifest, and previews on-demand
  4. Auto-reconnect and error resilience


üß≠ How It Works

  1. Select Components ‚Äì from your Figma file
  2. Fine-Tune ‚Äì add mappings to your codebase (optional)
  3. Export or Connect ‚Äì structured file export or live MCP server
  4. Generate Code ‚Äì AI tools use the specs to write code that aligns with your system


üìÅ Output Structure (Simplified)

export-[timestamp]/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ screen.yaml # Main screen specs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ manifest.yaml # File manifest
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/ # Component specs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles/ # Design token definitions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ icons/ # SVG exports
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ previews/ # PNG previews


Example screen.yaml

# screen.yaml
screen:
id: "signup-screen-001"
name: "SignupForm"
type: "FRAME"

dimensions:
width: 375
height: 812

styleRefs:
fills:
- "@styles/fills#background-default"
typography:
- "@styles/typography#body-normal"

children:
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#username-field-001"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#email-field-002"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#password-field-003"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/Button#signup-button-001"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextLink#login-link-001"


This defines a form-based screen layout with multiple input fields, a button, and a link‚Äîreferencing reusable components in the design system.


üîó spex-mcp

Install the companion server to integrate with AI dev tools:

‚Üí spex-mcp on npm


üí° Why SpeX?


For Designers

  1. Reduce handoff friction
  2. Track design usage across implementations


For Developers

  1. Avoid guesswork, get exact specs
  2. Leverage AI tools with full context


For AI Tools

  1. Access structured, hierarchical data
  2. Align generated code with real-world components


SpeX is where design systems meet automation. Your components. Your rules. Real code.
plugins.tagline: Built on your real components, not generic templates.

139516.name: SpeX - Design to Code by AI
139516.description:
SpeX ‚Äì Design to Code by AI


Transform your Figma components into AI-readable specs for seamless design-to-code automation.


üîç What is SpeX?

SpeX bridges design and development by exporting structured specifications from Figma‚Äîenabling AI tools like Cursor and GitHub Copilot to generate accurate, production-grade UI code that aligns with your actual components.


üéØ Who It's For

  1. Design system teams scaling reusable components
  2. Developers using AI coding assistants
  3. Product teams aiming for consistent handoffs
  4. Organizations enforcing structured design workflows


üöÄ Key Capabilities


üìã AI-Ready Export

  1. Export to YAML/JSON with full style tokens
  2. Support nested components, variants, and instances
  3. Auto-detect and optimize SVG icons
  4. Generate component preview thumbnails


üîß Fine-Tuning Metadata

  1. Add codeComponent and codeFilePath
  2. Auto-fill metadata via pattern recognition
  3. Visual tree browser with search and bulk editing


üóÉ Component Record Management

  1. Full CRUD for structured records
  2. Sync from Notion, APIs, or JSON files
  3. Filterable views with fallback thumbnails
  4. Export component registry as JSON


ü§ñ Real-Time AI Integration

  1. WebSocket-based MCP bridge for tools like Cursor AI
  2. Real-time dashboard and analytics
  3. Serve specs, manifest, and previews on-demand
  4. Auto-reconnect and error resilience


üß≠ How It Works

  1. Select Components ‚Äì from your Figma file
  2. Fine-Tune ‚Äì add mappings to your codebase (optional)
  3. Export or Connect ‚Äì structured file export or live MCP server
  4. Generate Code ‚Äì AI tools use the specs to write code that aligns with your system


üìÅ Output Structure (Simplified)

export-[timestamp]/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ screen.yaml # Main screen specs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ manifest.yaml # File manifest
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ components/ # Component specs
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ styles/ # Design token definitions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ icons/ # SVG exports
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ previews/ # PNG previews


Example screen.yaml

# screen.yaml
screen:
id: "signup-screen-001"
name: "SignupForm"
type: "FRAME"

dimensions:
width: 375
height: 812

styleRefs:
fills:
- "@styles/fills#background-default"
typography:
- "@styles/typography#body-normal"

children:
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#username-field-001"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#email-field-002"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextField#password-field-003"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/Button#signup-button-001"
- type: "INSTANCE_REF"
ref: "@components/TextLink#login-link-001"


This defines a form-based screen layout with multiple input fields, a button, and a link‚Äîreferencing reusable components in the design system.


üîó spex-mcp

Install the companion server to integrate with AI dev tools:

‚Üí spex-mcp on npm


üí° Why SpeX?


For Designers

  1. Reduce handoff friction
  2. Track design usage across implementations


For Developers

  1. Avoid guesswork, get exact specs
  2. Leverage AI tools with full context


For AI Tools

  1. Access structured, hierarchical data
  2. Align generated code with real-world components


SpeX is where design systems meet automation. Your components. Your rules. Real code.

manifest.name: SpeX - Design to Code by AI

139516.tagline: Built on your real components, not generic templates.

plugins.name: Figma to Unity Exporter
plugins.description:
### Tired of manually recreating your Figma designs in Unity?


Figma To Unity Importer is the ultimate workflow solution designed to bridge the gap between designers and developers. Stop wasting hours meticulously rebuilding UI and start converting your high-fidelity Figma designs into fully functional, native Unity uGUI components with just a few clicks.


**‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT: This is one half of a powerful 2-part system.**

This Figma plugin exports your design data. To bring your designs to life in Unity, you need the professional importer asset from the Unity Asset Store.


---


### **‚û°Ô∏è Step 1: Get the Professional Unity Importer Asset**


To complete the workflow, please purchase and import the required companion asset from the Unity Asset Store. It's the engine that powers the entire import process in Unity, packed with advanced features to ensure a perfect conversion.


**[>> Get "Figma To Unity Importer" on the Unity Asset Store ($15) <<](https://assetstore.unity.com/preview/323342/1075296)**


---


### **‚ú® Key Features:**


* **Accurate Conversion:** Preserves layer hierarchy, names, positions, sizes, and rotations.

* **Advanced Text Support:** Exports text as TextMeshPro components, maintaining font family, **font weight (including variable fonts)**, size, and color.

* **Image Export:** Automatically exports image fills and creates native Unity `Image` components.

* **Resolution Scaling:** Scale your entire UI to different screen sizes automatically.

* **Smart & Simple UI:** Remembers your last used settings and supports multiple languages.


### **üöÄ Workflow:**


**1. In Unity (Setup):**

* Purchase and import the importer from the Asset Store using the link above.

* Install the required packages as described in the asset's documentation (TextMeshPro, UI, Newtonsoft.Json).


**2. In Figma (Export):**

* Run this plugin.

* Select the single, top-level Frame you want to export.

* Configure your options (target resolution, include images, etc.).

* Click "Export" to download the `.zip` file.


**3. In Unity (Import):**

* Unzip the downloaded file.

* Drag the `FigmaExport` folder into your Unity `Assets`.

* Open the importer via `Tools > Figma Importer`.

* Assign the `hierarchy.json` file and click "Create UI".


That's it! Your design is now a native, ready-to-use UI in Unity.
plugins.tagline: The ultimate workflow bridge. Go from Figma design to a working Unity UI in minutes.

plugins.name: ProtoFlow ‚Äì Offline Clickable Prototypes
plugins.description:
üí° Cos'√® ProtoFlow?

ProtoFlow √® un plugin gratuito per Figma che ti permette di esportare un prototipo interattivo cliccabile in locale, in formato HTML + PNG. Nessun hosting, nessuna connessione internet necessaria. Basta un browser.


Perfetto per:


Test utente su dispositivi embedded


Demo da inviare ai clienti


Presentazioni offline


Contesti in cui Figma non √® accessibile


üöÄ Come funziona


Seleziona uno o pi√π frame da esportare.


Scegli il frame di partenza.


Risolvi eventuali errori o warning.


Clicca ‚ÄúScarica prototipo‚Äù.


Viene generato un archivio .zip con:


start.html: il file principale da aprire in locale


screens/: la cartella con tutte le schermate e i file HTML


README.txt: guida completa all‚Äôutilizzo


üß† Come sono gestite le interazioni?


Ogni collegamento tra frame in Figma diventa un link cliccabile nella pagina HTML.


Gli elementi con Navigate To + Instant vengono interpretati come hotspot.


Anche un‚Äôintera schermata pu√≤ essere interattiva.


üì¶ Cosa contiene il file ZIP?


start.html: la pagina iniziale del prototipo


screens/: tutte le schermate in PNG + HTML per ogni frame


README.txt: istruzioni complete all‚Äôuso, anche per utenti non tecnici


‚ö†Ô∏è Importante: non rinominare o spostare screens/, n√© i file .html o .png, altrimenti i collegamenti si romperanno.


üìò Istruzioni integrate

Nel tab "Istruzioni" del plugin trovi una guida dettagliata. Puoi anche consultare il file README.txt incluso nell‚Äôarchivio per avere una versione offline, utile da condividere con il tuo team o clienti.


üîê Nessun dato viene inviato online.

Tutto il processo avviene localmente nel tuo browser. Le immagini e i file generati non lasciano mai il tuo computer.


üë®‚Äçüíª Creato da

Francesco Cerisano (Havas Milan)
plugins.tagline: Esporta prototipi cliccabili offline da Figma in HTML+PNG. Perfetto per test e demo

plugins.name: Swap Dimensions
plugins.description:
Missing the quick frame orientation swap button from the old Figma UI?

This plugin brings that handy feature back‚Äîfast and simple!


Swap Dimensions is a lightweight Figma plugin that lets you instantly flip the dimensions of any selected frame ‚Äî from portrait to landscape or vice versa.


It also updates the Auto Layout direction accordingly, switching between horizontal and vertical when needed.


ü™Ñ Perfect for responsive design, prototyping, or quickly testing layouts in different orientations ‚Äî with a single click.


No UI, no setup ‚Äî just select a frame and run the plugin.
plugins.tagline: The missing frame orientation toggle from Figma's old UI ‚Äî back in one click.

136052.name: Swap Dimensions
136052.description:

It also updates the Auto Layout direction accordingly, switching between horizontal and vertical when needed.


ü™Ñ Perfect for responsive design, prototyping, or quickly testing layouts in different orientations ‚Äî with a single click.


No UI, no setup ‚Äî just select a frame and run the plugin.
136052.tagline: The missing frame orientation toggle from Figma's old UI ‚Äî back in one click.

plugins.name: Section Auto-Resize with 200px Margin
plugins.description:
This plugin automatically resizes Figma Sections to fit their content and adds a 200px margin around the content area. It's designed to help teams maintain consistent spacing and layout rules without manually adjusting section boundaries.


Perfect for teams working with grid systems, spacing standards, or design system alignment workflows.
plugins.tagline: Auto-resize sections and apply consistent 200px margin padding.

133400.name: Section Auto-Resize with 200px Margin
133400.description:
This plugin automatically resizes Figma Sections to fit their content and adds a 200px margin around the content area. It's designed to help teams maintain consistent spacing and layout rules without manually adjusting section boundaries.


Perfect for teams working with grid systems, spacing standards, or design system alignment workflows.
133400.tagline: Auto-resize sections and apply consistent 200px margin padding.

plugins.name: Disable "Clip content"
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that disables the ‚ÄúClip content‚Äù property on supported layers ‚Äì either across the entire file or just the selected ones. Originally built for internal use at DevExpress, it helps reduce noise in exported SVGs by removing unnecessary <clipPath> wrappers and keeping the markup clean.


Repo: https://github.com/alexfi1in/figma-disable-clip-content
plugins.tagline: A simple plugin to turn off ‚ÄúClip content‚Äù on selected layers or throughout the entire file.

133693.name: Disable "Clip content"
133693.description:
A Figma plugin that disables the ‚ÄúClip content‚Äù property on supported layers ‚Äì either across the entire file or just the selected ones. Originally built for internal use at DevExpress, it helps reduce noise in exported SVGs by removing unnecessary <clipPath> wrappers and keeping the markup clean.


Repo: https://github.com/alexfi1in/figma-disable-clip-content
133693.release_notes:
‚Äì Improved logging: the path to each modified clipsContent node is now printed in a structured, readable format with icons.
‚Äì Skipped clipsContent updates for INSTANCE nodes to avoid errors.
133693.tagline: A simple plugin to turn off ‚ÄúClip content‚Äù on selected layers or throughout the entire file.

plugins.name: Variant Randomizer
plugins.description:
Tired of manually clicking through component variants one by one just to create visual variety in your mockups? Variant Randomizer is here to help! This simple yet powerful Figma plugin lets you instantly randomize the variants applied to multiple selected components or instances that have more than one variant option.


How it Works:

Select multiple elements (components/instances) on your canvas.

Run the [Plugin Name] plugin.

Done! The plugin automatically assigns a random variant to each selected element that has multiple variants available. Elements with only one variant or no variants will be ignored.


Why use Variant Randomizer?

Save Valuable Time: Stop the tedious process of manually changing variants across many elements.

Create Realistic Mockups: Quickly add natural variation to lists, grids, user avatars, button states, icons, and more.

Boost Productivity: Perfect for working with design systems and large sets of components.

Simple & Fast: One-click operation after selection.

Works on Selection: Target only the elements you need to change.



You can help me mantain this plugin by Buying me a coffee!
plugins.tagline: nstantly randomize component variants across your selection.

plugins.name: SuperLayer (copy)
plugins.description:
SuperLayer (copy) lets you quickly view and copy the names of selected layers in your Figma file or FigJam board. It‚Äôs ideal for generating UI inventories, documentation, or simply organizing your layer structure. The plugin also shows each layer‚Äôs type and a thumbnail preview when available.


To use it, select one or more layers on your canvas and launch the plugin. A clean list view will appear with sorting options and checkboxes to include or exclude layers. Click the Copy button to copy all selected layer names to your clipboard, formatted line by line. The list updates automatically as you change your selection.


SuperLayer is optimized for speed and simplicity. It does not currently support exporting full metadata, nested hierarchy structures, or annotations. Thumbnails are generated when possible, but may not appear for certain FigJam elements or complex Figma nodes.
plugins.tagline: Copy Figma and FigJam layer names with ease. Sortable and perfect for docs, audits, and checklists

To use it, select one or more layers on your canvas and launch the plugin. A clean list view will appear with sorting options and checkboxes to include or exclude layers. Click the Copy button to copy all selected layer names to your clipboard, formatted line by line. The list updates automatically as you change your selection.


SuperLayer is optimized for speed and simplicity. It does not currently support exporting full metadata, nested hierarchy structures, or annotations. Thumbnails are generated when possible, but may not appear for certain FigJam elements or complex Figma nodes.

plugins.name: Quick Navigator
plugins.description:
Quick Navigator is a lightweight yet powerful plugin designed to help you stay oriented while working on large or complex Figma files. Instead of endlessly zooming and panning around, this plugin gives you a miniature view of your entire canvas thus making it easier than ever to find what you're looking for.


Features:

  1. See all your frames and sections in a simplified, scrollable mini window.
  2. Tap on any visible frame or section in the mini view to instantly select and focus it on the main canvas.
  3. Ideal when you're moving fast, experimenting, or managing chaotic canvases, no need for everything to be clean or structured.


NOTE: Currently, SVG shapes and text layers are not included in the mini view.
plugins.tagline: Never get lost on the canvas again!

plugins.name: Randomize
plugins.description:
How it Works:


Select Text Layers: Choose one or more text layers on your Figma canvas that you want to modify.


Open Randomize: Run the Randomize plugin.


Enter Your Items: In the input field, type or paste the different text strings you want to use, making sure each item is separated by a comma (,). For example: John Doe, Jane Smith, Alex Johnson, Maria Garcia


Click Randomize: Press the "Randomize" button.


See the Magic: The plugin will instantly replace the content of each selected text layer with a randomly selected item from the list you provided.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly populate selected text layers with random content from your custom list.

129638.name: Randomize
129638.description:
How it Works:

Open Randomize: Run the Randomize plugin.


Enter Your Items: In the input field, type or paste the different text strings you want to use, making sure each item is separated by a comma (,). For example: John Doe, Jane Smith, Alex Johnson, Maria Garcia


Click Randomize: Press the "Randomize" button.


See the Magic: The plugin will instantly replace the content of each selected text layer with a randomly selected item from the list you provided.
129638.tagline: Effortlessly populate selected text layers with random content from your custom list.

plugins.description:

  1. Expand to read details about each success criterion
  2. Copy links to W3C documentation
  3. Add all details to your Figma files with a single click

plugins.name: Sticky Note Maker
plugins.description:
Sticky Note Maker

Effortlessly add colorful sticky notes to your Figma designs. Perfect for annotations, feedback, and organizing ideas.


Key Features:

- Create sticky notes next to any selected frame (top-right) or centered in the viewport.

- Choose from 5 types: Note (blue), Fresh Idea (pink), Approved (green), Need Attention (yellow), Need Fix (red).

- Automatically includes your name and timestamp for easy tracking.

- Simple, icon-driven interface with color-coded hover and selection states.


How to Use:

1. Select a frame (or none for viewport placement).

2. Pick a sticky note type from the icon buttons.

3. Write your note and click "Create".


Ideal for designers, teams, and anyone who loves a visual way to comment and collaborate. Streamline your workflow with Sticky Note Maker!
plugins.tagline: Add colorful sticky notes to your designs. Perfect for annotations, feedback, organizing ideas.

plugins.name: Preview Card Creator
plugins.description:
Overview

Create a preview card from selected frames. The card contains images generated from the frames and a link back to the original Figma file allowing for easy navigation.


Why use this?

  1. Got summary or overview pages? This is useful for deeper linking into specific pages without having to be familiar with the file.
  2. Got a centralized file that contains the whole application? Stop the file from getting large by replacing full flows with a preview card that deep links to individual Figma files.
plugins.tagline: Create preview cards for summary or overview pages
